headline: Minnesota Jury Delivers $65.5 Million History-Making Verdict Against Johnson & Johnson
summary: ST. PAUL, Minn., December 20, 2025--A Minnesota jury awarded $65.5 million to a 37-year-old mother of three minor children after finding in her favor in a lawsuit against Johnson & Johnson, concluding that the company’s talc products exposed her to asbestos and contributed to her developing peritoneal mesothelioma, a cancer of the peritoneal lining in the stomach.

headline: What Developments Are Shifting the Narrative for Johnson & Johnson?
summary: Johnson & Johnson’s narrative in the market is shifting as its fair value estimate edges up from $202.54 to $209.29 and revenue growth expectations tick higher from 5.23% to about 5.32%, reflecting growing confidence in the company’s long term trajectory. Behind these moves is a more constructive Wall Street view on J&J’s portfolio, from the planned orthopedics separation to resilient demand in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, alongside easing concern around talc litigation and a belief that...
